Race.SummaryText:
PROPOSITION NO. 1
(GENERAL OBLIGATION BOND)

SUMMARY:  AUTHORITY TO ISSUE 25-YEAR BONDS TO THE AMOUNT OF $70,000,000 FOR THE PURPOSE OF ACQUIRING AND CONSTRUCTING A NEW COURTHOUSE, IMPROVING AND RENOVATING THE EXISTING COURTHOUSE AND RELATED FACILITIES AND ACQUIRING THE NECESSARY FURNISHINGS THEREFOR, TITLE TO WHICH SHALL BE IN THE PUBLIC, SAID BONDS TO BE PAYABLE FROM AD VALOREM TAXES.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of Lafayette, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), incur debt and issue bonds to the amount of Seventy Million Dollars ($70,000,000), to run twenty-five (25) years from date thereof, with interest at a rate not exceeding nine per centum (9%) per annum, to be sold at par, premium or discount, for the purpose of acquiring and constructing a new courthouse, improving and renovating the existing courthouse and related facilities and acquiring the necessary furnishings therefor, title to which shall be in the public; which bonds will be general obligations of the Parish and will be payable from ad valorem taxes to be levied and collected in the manner provided by Article VI, Section 33 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974 and statutory authority supplemental thereto?

Race.SpecificTitle: Parishwide -- Prop. #2 --2 Mill - City-Parish Council-10 Yr
Race.SummaryText:
PROPOSITION NO. 2
(PARISH COURTHOUSE TAX)

SUMMARY:  10-YEAR 2-MILL PARISH PROPERTY TAX FOR MAINTAINING, OPERATING AND IMPROVING THE COURTHOUSE COMPLEX.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of Lafayette, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), levy a two (2) mills tax on all the property subject to taxation in the Parish for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2007 and ending with the year 2016, for the purpose of maintaining, operating and improving the Lafayette Parish Courthouse Complex?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Lafayette -- 1% S&U/Bond - City-Parish Council
Race.SummaryText:
CITY OF LAFAYETTE PROPOSITION
(SALES TAX AND BOND)

SUMMARY:  AUTHORITY FOR THE CITY OF LAFAYETTE TO LEVY A 1% SALES AND USE TAX FOR (A) PURCHASING, CONSTRUCTING, ACQUIRING, EXTENDING, IMPROVING, EQUIPPING AND FURNISHING STREETS, BRIDGES, TRAFFIC AND DRAINAGE PUBLIC WORKS OR CAPITAL IMPROVEMENTS FOR SAID CITY AND (B) PAYING THE OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE EXPENSES OF SAID CITY; PROVIDED, HOWEVER, NOT LESS THAN EIGHTY PERCENT (80%) MUST BE APPROPRIATED AND EXPENDED FOR THE PURPOSES OF PURCHASING, CONSTRUCTING, ACQUIRING, EXTENDING, IMPROVING, EQUIPPING AND FURNISHING STREETS, BRIDGES, TRAFFIC AND DRAINAGE PUBLIC WORKS OR CAPITAL IMPROVEMENTS FOR SAID CITY, AND FURTHER FOR SAID TAX TO BE FUNDED INTO BONDS.
Race.FullText:
Shall the City of Lafayette, State of Louisiana (the "City"), be authorized to levy and collect a tax of one percent (1%) (the "Tax") upon the sale at retail, the use, the lease or rental, the consumption, and the storage for use or consumption, of tangible personal property and on the sales of services in the City, except that as provided in Act 2 of 1982, the tax shall not be collected on food and prescription drug items exempted from state sales and use taxes under R.S. 47:305D(4) (formerly R.S. 47:305(4)); with the avails or proceeds of said tax, after paying the reasonable and necessary costs of administering and collecting said tax (the "Avails"), to be dedicated, appropriated and expended for the purpose of (a) purchasing, constructing, acquiring, extending, improving, equipping and furnishing streets, bridges, traffic and drainage public works or capital improvements for said City and (b) paying the operation and maintenance expenses of said City; provided, however, not less than eighty percent (80%) must be appropriated and expended for the purposes of purchasing, constructing, acquiring, extending, improving, equipping and furnishing streets, bridges, traffic and drainage public works or capital improvements for said City; and shall the City be further authorized to fund the Avails into bonds from time to time for the capital purposes set forth above and further set out in the Lafayette City-Parish Consolidated Government's then current Capital Improvement Budget adopted after public hearings held in the manner contemplated by the Home Rule Charter of said Lafayette City-Parish Consolidated Government, paying the costs of issuance of such bonds and establishing a reserve for the payment thereof, to the extent and in the manner permitted by the laws of Louisiana?
urpose of maintaining, operating and improving the Lafayette Parish Courthouse Complex?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Carencro -- 1% S&U - City-Parish Council
Race.SummaryText:
CITY OF CARENCRO SALES TAX DISTRICT PROPOSITION
(SALES TAX)

SUMMARY:  AUTHORITY FOR THE CITY OF CARENCRO SALES TAX DISTRICT TO LEVY A 1% SALES AND USE TAX FOR PURCHASING, CONSTRUCTING, ACQUIRING, EXTENDING, MAINTAINING AND IMPROVING PUBLIC WORKS OR CAPITAL IMPROVEMENTS FOR SAID DISTRICT AND ACQUIRING THE NECESSARY EQUIPMENT AND FURNISHINGS THEREFOR AND PAYING DEBT SERVICE ON ANY OBLIGATIONS ISSUED TO FINANCE SUCH IMPROVEMENTS, WITH THE AVAILS TO BE EXPENDED AND USED BY AND FOR THE CITY OF CARENCRO, LOUISIANA, IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE PROVISIONS OF AN INTERGOVERNMENTAL AGREEMENT BETWEEN SAID DISTRICT AND SAID CITY.
Race.FullText: Shall the City of Carencro Sales Tax District of the Parish of Lafayette, State of Louisiana (the "District"), be authorized to levy and collect a tax of one percent (1%) (the "Tax") upon the sale at retail, the use, the lease or rental, the consumption, and the storage for use or consumption, of tangible personal property and on the sales of services in the District, all as presently defined in Chapter 2, Subtitle II of Title 47 of the Louisiana Revised Statutes of 1950, as amended, except that as provided in Act 2 of 1982, the tax shall not be collected on food and prescription drug items presently exempted from state sales and use taxes under R.S. 47:305D(4) (formerly R.S. 47:305(4)); with the avails or proceeds of said tax, after paying the reasonable and necessary costs of administering, collecting and distributing the Tax (the "Avails"), to be dedicated, appropriated and expended for the purpose of purchasing, constructing, acquiring, extending, maintaining, operating and improving public works or capital improvements for said District and acquiring the necessary equipment and furnishings therefor, and paying debt service on any obligations issued to finance such improvements, with the Avails to be expended and used by and for the City of Carencro, Louisiana (the "City"), in accordance with the provisions of an intergovernmental agreement between the District and the City?

Race.SpecificTitle: Town of Duson -- 1% S&U - City-Parish Council
Race.SummaryText:
TOWN OF DUSON SALES TAX DISTRICT PROPOSITION
(SALES TAX)

SUMMARY:  AUTHORITY FOR THE TOWN OF DUSON SALES TAX DISTRICT TO LEVY A 1% SALES AND USE TAX FOR PURCHASING, CONSTRUCTING, ACQUIRING, EXTENDING, MAINTAINING AND IMPROVING PUBLIC WORKS OR CAPITAL IMPROVEMENTS FOR SAID DISTRICT AND ACQUIRING THE NECESSARY EQUIPMENT AND FURNISHINGS THEREFOR AND PAYING DEBT SERVICE ON ANY OBLIGATIONS ISSUED TO FINANCE SUCH IMPROVEMENTS, WITH THE AVAILS TO BE EXPENDED AND USED BY AND FOR THE TOWN OF DUSON, LOUISIANA, IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE PROVISIONS OF AN INTERGOVERNMENTAL AGREEMENT BETWEEN SAID DISTRICT AND SAID TOWN.
Race.FullText: Shall the Town of Duson Sales Tax District of the Parish of Lafayette, State of Louisiana (the "District"), be authorized to levy and collect a tax of one percent (1%) (the "Tax") upon the sale at retail, the use, the lease or rental, the consumption, and the storage for use or consumption, of tangible personal property and on the sales of services in the District, all as presently defined in Chapter 2, Subtitle II of Title 47 of the Louisiana Revised Statutes of 1950, as amended, except that as provided in Act 2 of 1982, the tax shall not be collected on food and prescription drug items presently exempted from state sales and use taxes under R.S. 47:305D(4) (formerly R.S. 47:305(4)); with the avails or proceeds of said tax, after paying the reasonable and necessary costs of administering, collecting and distributing the Tax (the "Avails"), to be dedicated, appropriated and expended for the purpose of purchasing, constructing, acquiring, extending, maintaining, operating and improving public works or capital improvements for said District and acquiring the necessary equipment and furnishings therefor, and paying debt service on any obligations issued to finance such improvements, with the Avails to be expended and used by and for the Town of Duson, Louisiana (the "Town"), in accordance with the provisions of an intergovernmental agreement between the District and the Town?

Race.SpecificTitle: Sales Tax District No. 1 -- 1% S&U - City-Parish Council
Race.SummaryText:
SALES TAX DISTRICT NO. 1 PROPOSITION

SUMMARY:  AUTHORITY FOR SALES TAX DISTRICT NO. 1 TO LEVY A 1% SALES AND USE TAX FOR (a) PURCHASING, CONSTRUCTING, ACQUIRING, EXTENDING, IMPROVING, EQUIPPING AND FURNISHING STREETS, BRIDGES, TRAFFIC AND DRAINAGE PUBLIC WORKS OR CAPITAL IMPROVEMENTS FOR SAID DISTRICT AND (b) PAYING THE OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE EXPENSES OF SAID DISTRICT; PROVIDED, HOWEVER, NOT LESS THAN 80% MUST BE APPROPRIATED AND EXPENDED FOR THE PURPOSES OF PURCHASING, CONSTRUCTING, ACQUIRING, EXTENDING, IMPROVING, EQUIPPING AND FURNISHING STREETS, BRIDGES, TRAFFIC AND DRAINAGE PUBLIC WORKS OR CAPITAL IMPROVEMENTS FOR SAID DISTRICT; AND PAYING DEBT SERVICE ON ANY OBLIGATIONS ISSUED TO FINANCE SUCH IMPROVEMENTS.
Race.FullText: Shall Sales Tax District No. 1 of the Parish of Lafayette, State of Louisiana (the "District"), under the provisions of Article VI, Section 30 of the Louisiana Constitution of 1974, and other constitutional and statutory authority, be authorized to levy and collect, and adopt an ordinance providing for such levy and collection, an additional tax of one percent (1%)(the "Tax") upon the sale at retail, the use, the lease or rental, the consumption, and the storage for use or consumption, of tangible personal property and on the sales of services in the District, all as presently defined in Chapter 2, Subtitle II of Title 47 of the Louisiana Revised Statutes of 1950, as amended, except that as provided in Act 2 of 1982, the tax shall not be collected on food and prescription drug items presently exempted from state sales and use taxes under R.S. 47:305D(4) (formerly R.S. 47:305(4)); with the avails or proceeds of said tax, after paying the reasonable and necessary costs of administering and collecting said tax (the "Avails"), to be dedicated, appropriated and expended for the purpose of (a) purchasing, constructing, acquiring, extending, improving, equipping and furnishing streets, bridges, traffic and drainage public works or capital improvements for said District and (b) paying the operation and maintenance expenses of said District; provided, however, not less than eighty percent (80%) must be appropriated and expended for the purposes of purchasing, constructing, acquiring, extending, improving, equipping and furnishing streets, bridges, traffic and drainage public works or capital improvements for said District; and paying debt service on any obligations issued to finance such improvements?
